intro: Graffenrieda hitchcockii var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially shaded environments. It is a perennial herb that produces showy, often pink or purple flowers during the spring and summer months. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant for native gardens and ecological landscapes.
